title: Mourinho unsure about Pogba's availability for Sevilla game
text: March 12, 2018 / 4:32 AM / Updated 2 hours ago Mourinho unsure about Pogba's availability for Sevilla game Reuters Staff 2 Min Read (Reuters) - Manchester United are uncertain about midfielder Paul Pogba’s availability for Tuesday’s Champions League last 16 clash with Sevilla, manager Jose Mourinho said after the Frenchman missed their 2-1 Premier League win over Liverpool at the weekend. Soccer Football - Premier League - Everton vs Manchester United - Goodison Park, Liverpool, Britain - January 1, 2018 Manchester United's Paul Pogba takes a throw-in as Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho and Everton manager Sam Allardyce look on REUTERS/Andrew Yates EDITORIAL USE ONLY. No use with unauthorized audio, video, data, fixture lists, club/league logos or "live" services. Online in-match use limited to 75 images, no video emulation. No use in betting, games or single club/league/player publications. Please contact your account representative for further details. Pogba was ruled out after picking up an injury in the team’s final training session before the match and Mourinho is awaiting information on whether he can shake off the knock in time for the visit of the Spanish side. “I don’t know,” Mourinho told British media when asked about Pogba’s availability for the second leg of their last 16 match. “He’s downstairs now and I will go and speak with him. The injury? It was contact with a player in the last minute of the training session. “If I finished the session one minute before it wouldn’t have happened,” the Portuguese manager added. United’s record signing Pogba has been criticised for his performances this season and Mourinho benched the 24-year-old for their goalless draw at Sevilla in the first leg last month. Pogba came on as a substitute early in that game after midfielder Ander Herrera pulled up injured. Reporting by Shrivathsa Sridhar in Bengaluru; editing by Sudipto Ganguly
